body:
Beste,

Voor een klant in Brussel zoeken wij een Qliksense expert :

We currently develop our reports using SAS VA and\/or QlikSense.
The goal of the project is to support us in successfully migrating (and improving) the SAS VA reports to the QlikSense environment.

The tasks of the Qliksense & SAS VA expert are:

-        Analyze the AS IS situation in SAS VA

o   Understanding the model

o   Indentify the sources

o   Understand how the report\/dashboard is built (which sources, how and why are they transformed, what’s the goal of each transformation)

o   Understand the requirements (and challenge where\/if needed) for building the report

·        Define the TO BE situation in QlikSense

o   How to adapt the model (flat table --> star schema)

o   How to optimize the model

o   Reproduce and improve the visuals of the dashboard using the specific functionalities of QlikSense

o   Define (and manage when needed) the accesses in QlikSense (to the stream, app and data)

·        Support the Product Owner in the migration

·        Be the point of contact for QlikSense migration related questions

·        Improve the migrated reports (performance, story telling, look & feel)

·        Ensure the governance to build the reports is implemented

·       Document the best practices and the methodology to succesfully migrate and develop reports in QlikSense

Profile:

·       Knowledge and hands-on experience with the visualization of data in QlikSense (knowledge of other visualization tools is a plus – i.e. SAS VA, Qlikview)

·       Knowledge of data transformations with relational databases (and optional big data environments – Hadoop, (Py)Spark, SAS)

·       Strong interest in data visualization and motivated with the challenge of data in a diverse and changing technological landscape.

·       Strong analytical skills and sense of synthesis, ability to structure complex situations

·       Experience with the functional and technical aspects of data visualization within an analytics and information management context (business intelligence, reporting and data warehousing)

body:
Collega’s,

Voor D’Ieteren, vestiging Kortenberg zoeken we een (Power) BI Consultant die voldoet aan volgende profielbeschrijving:

Description:

Description of the company:
D'Ieteren Automotive is the largest family-owned company in the Belgian automotive industry.
Our ambition : being the number one mobility provider in Belgium by developing the most comprehensive portfolio of mobility solutions.
The vision of the Sales Insights & Analytics department is to deliver actionable & impactful insights & forecasts ​for business decisions.
We cover the following businesses:

  1.  the import, distribution and sale of the Volkswagen, Audi, Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles, SEAT, CUPRA, Skoda and Porsche brands to private and fleet owners
  2.  the sale of used cars under the Audi Approved Plus and MyWay labels
  3.  the sale of other products and services, provided by our subsidiaries, such as Volkswagen D'Ieteren Finance (VDFin), Electric by D'Ieteren (EDI), original accessories, ... and more new businesses to come.

Summary of role and expectations:
The primary task will be to help our Used Car & Group Mobility specialist to build relevant reports in PowerBI. During this process focus will be on understanding the business needs and creating the optimal UX.
A secondary challenge will be to improve the interaction between the different business themes within the Power BI environment.
A final part of the assignment will be to document reports, create intuitive and easily accessible training tools.

List of key skills required:

  1.  Advanced Knowledge of Power BI :
     *   Desktop & Paginated reports
     *   DAX language (creation of measures)
  2.  Good understanding of databases. You will work closely with our IT-Data department: datasets provided by IT, use of JIRA for communication on needs and validation
  3.  Make the numbers talk: enthusiastic about data visualization (UX!). The ultimate goal is to have reporting tools that support data-based business decisions
  4.  Good at creation of technical and business documentations (definitions, measures descriptions, ...)
  5.  Meticulous in data validation
  6.  Communication skills to interact with the business
  7.  Language : fluent in French, good knowledge of Dutch (on the job) & English (in the reports)

More information

  1.  Homeworking possible
  2.  On site presence mandatory on tuesdays and thursdays (Kortenberg office)
  3.  One site presence mandatory once a month (Braine l'Alleud office - on thursdays - day to be confirmed)

Our values

  1.  PERSEVERANCE: We value showing grit in the face of obstacles
  2.  HONOURABLE: We value being true to our word
  3.  CURIOUS BOLDNESS: We value continuous learning and acting with daring intent
  4.  SUPPORTIVE: We really care about each other’s success
  5.  ENTHUSIASM: We value expressing emotions as part of our true selves

Roles:

  *   Medior   Consultant BI Most recent experience This year
  *   Medior   Power BI Developer Most recent experience This year
  *   Medior   User Experience \/Data Visualization Expert Most recent experience This year

Skills:

  *   Business documentation                    Level Advanced
  *   DAX                                                        Level Advanced
  *   Jira                                                          Level Nice to have
  *   Meticulous in Data validation                Level Advanced
  *   Paginated reports                                Level Intermediate
  *   Power BI                                                Level Advanced
  *   Report Builder                                      Level Advanced
  *   Team work                                            Level Advanced
  *   UX                                                           Level Intermediate

Do you have experience in Report Builder?
If YES, can you share \/ explain your main achievements in Power BI Report Builder ?
Could you please share your Power BI portfolio showing your user interface skills (anonymized )?


Talen:

  *   Dutch: Professional working proficiency
  *   French: Professional working proficiency
  *   English: Professional working proficiency

Location:

  *   Main address: Leuvensesteenweg, 639 - 3071 Kortenberg
  *   Partially remote

Duurtijd: 09\/01\/2023  – 31\/12\/2023  (12 months - full time)
Richttarief: 590€ - 740€\/dag (eindprijs)

Deadline voor indiening: 02\/12\/2022

met vriendelijke groet,

body:
Hallo,

Voor Volvo zoeken we een BI-architect.
Graag cv, kp en beschikbaarheden van eigen medewerkers of rechtstreekse freelancers.
Mvg,

Philip



Assignment Description: As a BI architect, He or she would be responsible for the design of the proposed data architecture on technical level.
• He or she will take part in modernization of Volvo Group BI & Analytics landscape. In 2021\/2022 we will migrate BI applications (both Back-end and Front-end) to the Cloud (MS Azure).
• He or she will be in charge of modeling needs (both new needs and corrections or improvements of existing flow\/integrations) and will design\/extend advanced conceptual, logical and physical datamodels, within a complete functional and technical architecture
• He or she will work together with other BI architects, BI analysts, BI infrastructure experts and BI developers to define technical strategy and optimal integration within the existing VOLVO BI landscape.
• Translation of the designed solution towards BI developers, reviewing proposed solutions and optimizing where needed will be part of this role
• He or she will participate to the definition of a testing strategy
• Design, develop and continuously improve supporting activities (automation of versioning, release mgmt., scheduling, security models)


Needs:
• Business intelligence architect, at least 5 \/6 years of experience and adapting quickly to the way of working in the VOLVO BI landscape and process and guidelines
• Being able to understand and taking up the necessary knowledge about the BI application he\/she would be working for in a fast and efficient way.

Soft skills
• Teamplayer
• High level of communication skills
• Taking initiative!
• Proactive, ‘detecting improvements’ mindset
• Being able to work on different topics at the same time.
• Stress resistant
• Being able to switch priorities if needed
• Good in writing the necessary documentation (and feedback reporting)

Technical skills
• BI architect competence and experience of at least 5\/6 years
• Knowing the BI concepts \/ general DWH principles are a must
• Ralph Kimball, Bill Inmon, Dan linstedt are known
• Knowledge of latest market trends (big data, Cloud, …) is a must
• Azure Cloud Architecture knowledge is a must
• Experience of working in large companies
• Datavault principles: understanding is a must but developing via Wherescape is an asset
• Advanced knowledge and experience in datawarehouse dimensional modelling: must
• Powerdesigner is a must
• Analytical and problem-solving skills: must
• SQL, PL SQL competence: must
• ETL – Powercenter Informatica development is a must even if it won’t be the main task since we have other BI developers to concentrate on the BI development. Be aware that in some situations BI ETL development may be necessary (for instance to speed up performance etc)
• SAP BI frontend tool development is an asset
• Qlik (Qlikview, Qliksense) or other dashboarding tools like PowerBi are an asset
• IBM Netteza competence is an asset
• Oracle competence is an asset (might be needed when working on multiple platforms)

Language skills:
• English





Philip Veen
Business Development Manager
Mobile :  +32 (0)475 79 04 73
Fax : +32 (0)3 451 23 92
Phone : +32 (0)3 451 23 91
Address : Veldkant 33a – 2550 Kontich – Belgium

body:
Collega’s,

Voor onze klant Telenet te Mechelen zoek ik 3 extra Data Warehouse consultants die zo snel mogelijk kunnen starten tot einde 2022.

Deze extra nood is omwille van :

  *   Cloud migratie van hun ERP. Hierdoor moeten data flows worden aangepast of gebouwd. Hier zoek ik naar een versterking van 1 extra BI data engineer.
  *   Voor de go live van de back-office applicatie moeten ze voor de data scientists heel wat nieuwe features bouwen. Concreet zoek ik hier 2 extra data engineers om hen te versterken bij deze workload.
Hieronder kan je de normale jobdescriptie vinden voor een dergelijk profiel.

Job description
•      Turn raw data into trustworthy analytical datasets, that decreases time to market towards insights and reduces the TCO of data consumption
•      Manage these datasets (and the related data pipeline) as a product with all the responsibilities that comes with it:
o    own a part of the data product roadmap, which we prioritize as a team on a quarterly basis to fuel the overall company roadmap & initiatives with analytics
o    fit our data products with the overall data architecture, governance, standards & guidelines
o    design, build & test our data products
…meeting the functional & non-functional requirements,
…meeting the high standards for data ingestion, processing & storage
…and applying the right level of trust (quality, privacy, security) for their purpose
o    communicate on a regular basis to our stakeholders to increase data product awareness & usage
•      Strive continuously to reduce business as usual & keeping the lights on efforts through
data innovation & automation…
•      …freeing up time to co-create on our big value transformation cases together with data & analytics experts (like insights & reporting analysts, CRM, data scientists, application owners, functional\/business analysts,…)
•      Work in a young & dynamic team of analysts & engineers, operating in a self- organizing agile at company scale context and within a large internal & external data ecosystem

We are looking for
a passionate, motivated, proactive, eager to learn data enthusiast that says what’s what, works better together, can set things in motion and who is at his\/her best in a very challenging, innovative, flexible & dynamic company and Telecom industry, having:
•      5+ years of experience in a Data or Software Engineer role
•      Ideally attained a graduate or master’s degree in computer science, informatics, information systems, statistics or another analytical oriented education.

•      Experience in
o    Designing, building, testing and optimizing data pipelines in a Data Warehousing \/ Business Intelligence \/ Data Mart … context
o    ETL processes & tools (e.g. IBM InfoSphere Data Stage, DBT, …)
o    Oracle SQL
•      Working knowledge of below technologies is a plus:
o    Unix
o    Cloud:
            Snowflake
            AWS Redshift Step Functions, Cloudformation, S3, …
o    Methodologies as Agile Scrum, DevOps, …
o    BI tools (Qlik Sense)
o    Kafka, NiFi, Python, Java, Scala, …
o    The Communications Logical Data Model (CLDM) of Teradata
•      The right ethical mindset with regards to data privacy, security & governance
•      Fluent in English. Dutch is a plus.

Gr


Guy Van de Vel
Account Manager

CRONOS NV
Veldkant 33A
2550 KONTICH

M  + 32 477 872 447

Titel: Business\/Funct. Analyst (1. Junior (1-3)
Locatie: The Netherlands - Zoeterwoude (Energieweg 33, 2382 NC Zoeterwoude, Nederland)
Status: Gepubliceerd
Type contract: Time & material

Aantal personen: 1
Afdeling: Technology Platform (TP)

Omschrijving

About the Role

Reporting to the Manager of the Cloud Business Office, the Cloud and Hosting Services Analyst for SWIFT will be helping to collect and analyze data to provide Cloud financial insights critical to our success as a business as it relates to an Infrastructure and Operations organization.

Responsibilities:

-Produce insightful reports that can be shared with and actioned by Management
-Work effectively with cross-functional teams globally, assimilating requirements, driving results in the form of data insights and building strategic partnerships
-Support the FinOps team with setting goals\/KPIs, retrieving data and modeling
-Act as the technical expert for the Cost Transparency tools\/dashboards. This includes configuring functionality, creating\/enhancing visualizations, maintaining design and guidance documentation, and providing support
-Partner heavily with our Cloud Governance team to map data process flows, allowing FinOps to gather a single source of data source
-Analyze and forecast cloud hosting costs
-Provide cost optimization recommendations
-Create and maintain month-end and quarter-end reports
-Use Agile methodology for planning and execution
-Leverage the Cloud Financial Management (CFM) tools, interpret the findings, and make technical recommendations to the business application teams to help reduce ongoing cost

Professional Skills:

-Experience with automation technologies for CI\/CD (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, AWS Code pipeline)
-Experience with visualization tools (e.g., QuickSight, Power BI)
-Knowledge of cloud cost products (e.g., Cost Explorer, Azure Portal)
-Experience with Python, JSON, YAML, ARM, Cloud Formation
-Knowledge of cloud management and governance tools (e.g., Cloud Custodian, Trusted Advisor)
-Familiarity with monitoring tools such as CloudWatch, CloudTrail, etc.
-Detail-oriented with excellent documentation skills\/methodologies, who can successfully manage multiple priorities
-Demonstrable high level of intellectual curiosity, external perspective, and innovation interest
-Strong communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex technical topics to a non-technical or leadership audience

Qualifications:

-Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
-2+ years working in cloud computing or IT infrastructure\/platforms or Finance role
-2+ years of experience with AWS and\/or Azure




Vaardigheden

SPECIFIEKE VAARDIGHEDEN

AWS or Azure certification:   Ja
Cloud computing or IT infrastructure\/platforms or Finance role:   Junior (1-3) ( 2,00 jaar )
Cloud cost management tools:   Junior (1-3) ( 2,00 jaar )

body:
Collega’s,

Voor IBA, vestiging Louvain-la-Neuve zoeken we een Medior Data Engineer die voldoet aan volgende profielbeschrijving:

JOB DETAILS
Mission
Who are we?
The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, the most advanced technologies treatment against cancer.

Job Description

The Advanced Analytics team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to contribute to our centralized data warehouse and data lake and help our business teams with extracting insights from data. You'll use your experience to work closely with other data engineers and our data architect to ensure that your setup is maintainable, scalable and in line with increasing business needs.
What we value
Must-have:
•    At least 4 years of relevant experience
•    Hands-on experience with software and architectural design
•    Proficient in Python and SQL (DBT)
•    Relevant cloud experience (Azure preferred)
•    Experience with delta lake, database assets
•    Experience with data modelling techniques
•    Experience with container orchestration technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, ...)
•    Experience with CI/CD pipelines
•    Experience with Databricks
•    Platform-oriented mindset
•    Fluent in English, French is a plus
•    Passionate about data

Nice to have:
•    Experience with Power BI
•    Experience with IoT solutions or data streaming
•    Experience with MLOps

Life at IBA
Diversity is fundamental to our culture. We value the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives and talents they bring to IBA. We learn from and respect the cultures in which we work, promote diversity within our workforce, and have an inclusive environment that helps each and every one of us to fully contribute to IBA’s success.

The identity of IBA is characterized by a group of colleagues driven by motivation, curiosity, creativity, the desire to learn on a daily basis, by technical challenges and above all by a highly developed team and family spirit that makes the daily life smoother and more enjoyable!

By joining a team of about 40 nationalities and working on more than 45 different sites on 3 continents, IBA offers you the opportunity of a meaningful career with a direct impact in the fight against cancer.

We are driven by:

  *   Innovating in a cutting-edge technology environment

  *   Developing professional and personal skills by learning on the Job; by participating in challenging projects; top class courses

  *   Evolving in a friendly culture environment based upon solid values (dare - share - care - be fair)

  *   Acting autonomously and belonging to motivated teams with good work-life balance

  *   Contributing to a company where sustainability, safety and well-being are key to our success

 Roles:

     *   Medior Data Engineer Most recent experience   This year

Skills:

  *   CI/CD pipelines Level   Intermediate   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Cloud experience (Azure preferred) Level   Advanced   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Container orchestration technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, ...) Level   Intermediate   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Data modelling techniques Level   Intermediate   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Databricks Level   Intermediate   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Delta lake, Database assets Level   Intermediate   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Hands-on experience with software and architectural design Level   Advanced   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   Python Level   Advanced   Most recent experience   Any time
  *   SQL Level   Advanced   Most recent experience   Any time

Talen:

  *   English Level   Native or bilingual proficiency
  *   French Level   Limited working proficiency

Location:

  *   Main address: chemin du cyclotron, 3 - 1348 Louvain-la-Neuve
  *   Partially remote


Duurtijd: 08/01/2024 - 30/06/2024 - 6 months (full time)
Richttarief: 725€ dag (eindprijs)

Deadline voor indiening: 03/01/2024

body:
Dear,

Role category -
Role profile
 S5 - Data
 Data Engineer - Senior
Job title
 Data Engineer
Work location
 BRU.-MONTAGNE DU PARC/WARANDEBERG
 MONTAGNE DU PARC 3
 1000 BRUXELLES
Start date
 01/12/2023
End date
 29/11/2024
Description

Mission context

Data Engineer

The Data Hub tribe is one of the key components of the Data department, to help developing and rolling out the bank-wide BI and Data strategy at BNP Paribas Fortis.  Its mission is to service all metiers and functions of the bank with transversal BI solutions (front and backend developments) & tools. In doing so, the Data Hub team will contribute  to the spreading of the new data governance and “Know your data” culture throughout BNPP Fortis.
Function  description


- As a data engineer / data modeller you establish, improve  and deploy modelling standard&guidelines for the whole Datehub tribe by coaching and assisting the data engineers in the usage of these S&G.


?- As a data engineer / data modeller  you will assess on a regular basis the datamodels on the correct application of the rules/guidelines/standards by the data engineers.  This involves a close collaboration with the data architects and data managers and a detailed knowledge of  the BNP Paribas Fortis standards.


?- As a data engineer / data modeller you will create awareness on data modelling by promoting techniques that make sense via chapter meetings or by giving trainings to functional and technical data engineers


?- As a data engineer /  data modeller  you will act as a DBA in the NON-PROD environment by supporting the technical data engineers in the preparation , in the validation and in the execution of the ORACLE scripts. Also support the data engineers in optimizing performance on existing databases.


?- As a data engineer /  data modeller you follow  and develop yourself in the recent  IT-and DATA evolutions (internal and external) and propose innovative data solutions that can help  improve business activities.



With the squad, the data engineer works on solution description and implementation of different projects and enhancements within the big data hub-environment .  Main technologies used on the data hub platform are Scala, Java, Kafka, Flink, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, ... Having experience in building applicative framework and generic components on the datahub is a must have.

This mission will focus on what we call the run the  bank activities where the focus will be monitoring the operational environments, keep them in a good shape, identify tracks of continuous improvement.  Also the deployments on the dathub  in a the NON-PROD and PROD environment is an important activity in this mission. Accuracy in the preparation and the execution of the deployments as well as good communication are crucial for this mission.
 Language requirements
Dutch


  *   Preferable , but not mandatory
French


  *   Preferable , but not mandatory
English


  *   Sound knowledge
Education


  *   Bachelor/Master ‘s degree in IT or engineering or equivalent by professional experience
Certification

Travel

Agile requirements
An analyst involved in Agile projects must have the "Agile mindset" which implies:

  *   a positive attitude and pragmatism
  *   thirst for knowledge: Agile is about learning and adapting. Knowledge sharing is key to success.
  *   The goal of team success: Agile is about the success of the team, no individual success or heroic behavior. It is more important for the team to succeed than for the individual to have completed his/her tasks.
  *   There is no failure, only feedback: Agile is about taking everything as lessons, adjusting actions based on the feedback, resulting in continuous improvement.


Beyond the roles:  Agile teams are cross-functional.  All required disciplines are represented in the team (analysis, development, testing, … ). However, although team members have a primary role representing a discipline, they are expected to take on other roles and contribute to other disciplines  whenever it helps towards reaching the sprint goal.
Required experience / knowledge
At least 5 years of relevant experience
Technical experience
mandatory


  *

?You have at least 5 years of experience with data in any of the financial domain (product related, business related).  Having a significant experience in Big Data technologies and platforms is an advantage.


  *

?You have practical experience with Datavault modelling.  You are familiar with Powerdesigner or any other modelling tool.

preferable


  *   Knowing and experienced DEVOPS-practices.
Business experience
mandatory
Experience with working in a complex organization
preferable
Specific requirement for agile: practical experience with Scrum
Soft skills

·       Good analytical and problem solving skills.
·       Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
·       Team player  always ready to share, train or provide support to others.
·       Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
·       Flexible, accurate & control minded.
·       Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
·       Ability to deliver results respecting deadlines
·       Good oral and written communication. Ability to turn advanced technical topics and industry jargon into easy-to-understand information .
·       Quality driven and cost avoidance minded
·       Able to handle changing priorities
·       Customer focus
·       Passionate about data



  Please submit your candidate in the attached template!

Tx!


[CRONOS-logo]

Kind regards,
Kristin
Business development & Account Management

label: DATA_ENGINEER

body:
Beste,

Voor onze klant bpost in Brussel zoeken wij een Enterprise Data Architect.
Dit is voor een vervanging van de huidige consultant.

De job bestaat uit 3 delen :

  *   Opzetten van Strategische Data Governance (30%)

Bestaande systemen op orde zetten en optimaliseren (60%)

  *   Coaching van een interne Enterprise Data Architect (10%

We zoeken iemand met een technische data achtergrond in AWS en/of Azure (minstens 1 met diepgaande kennis), die zelfsturend en zelfstandig kan werken in een startup omgeving.

Beschikbaarheid zo snel mogelijk.

De klant omschrijft het als volgt :

As an Enterprise Data Architect, your primary responsibilities will be to assist in establishing Data Governance practices, analyze data platforms on AWS and Azure from an architectural perspective, and propose new architecture solutions.
Additionally, you will be expected to possess coaching abilities to mentor and guide our new data architect.
You will report to the Chief Enterprise Architect which manages the architecture team currently consisting of 5 Enterprise Architects and 4 solution Architects.

As an Enterprise Data Architect, you will be responsible for:

  *   Coach and support architects in training by sharing your experience, best practices and offering them guidance and advice.
  *   Setting up data governance practice: Responsibilities include establishing policies, processes, and frameworks to ensure effective management and utilization of data assets based on industry standards and best practices.
  *   collaborating with stakeholders:  to define data standards, promoting data privacy and compliance, and implementing governance mechanisms.
  *   Data Migration Roadmap: Provide expert guidance and advisory support as a Data Architect in the development of a comprehensive roadmap for the migration of the organization's data platform and reporting systems.
  *   Take part in the existing governance practices within the architecture Way of Working (e.g. PI planning, Quarterly business review, Architecture Center of Excellence, daily standups, peer reviews, …)
  *   Act as a steward for the new data platform: providing ongoing guidance and support to ensure the proper implementation of governance principles and best practices. Monitor and assess compliance with governance policies and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.

Your profile:
The ideal candidate for an Enterprise Architect position should have:


  *   Degree in Engineering, Informatics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience.
  *   Professional working proficiency in English and either French or Dutch.
  *   Minimum of 5 years of experience as an Enterprise Architect or in a similar role.
  *   Proven experience as an Enterprise Data Architect, including expertise in establishing Data Governance practices.
  *   Strong technical proficiency in analyzing and evaluating data platforms on AWS and Azure.
  *   Familiarity with modern data integration techniques, data warehousing, and data modeling.
  *   Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data architecture.
  *   Excellent coaching and mentoring abilities to support the growth and development of team members.
  *   Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to engage effectively with various stakeholders.
  *   Strong interest in both business and IT topics, acting as a bridge between the two domains.
  *   Certification in relevant technologies and frameworks (e.g., AWS, Azure, TOGAF) is a plus.
  *   Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience in an international project and program environment.

Assignment for 3 months with possible extension up to 6 months and +

Graag ontvangen wij jullie jullie feedback met Cv, beschikbaarheid en kostprijs naar mijzelf en Diederik  (cc).

Mvg,


Key Account Manager

body:
Dear P&C,

Norwegian Airlines has an urgent request:


They are looking for a skilled data architect (immediately) who has the perspective of data engineering and analytics in mind to help Norwegian build a best practice architecture for a data driven base on their currently implemented platform.



  *   They are currently moving from on prem to cloud with a full AWS strategy.
  *   They are already using various SaaS apps and cloud-based services (no time during the meeting to get into details)
  *   First move solutions that are made for the cloud. Meaning, they are deliberately avoiding any lift and shift.
  *   Analytics platform is in place - one of the first systems - building the rest around and on it
  *   Moving some focus towards business critical services which will be transferred to AWS.
  *   Data used for making the company more efficient - weight, balance, fuel
  *   Assessment first what is there, what is needed to reach a well architected base - essential starting point

Please send me CV's, availability and day rate asap.

Thank you.



 Kind regards / Med vänlig hälsning,



Esma 

Co-founder / Managing Director





##################@email.com

body:
Beste collega’s,

Voor onze klant Telenet te Mechelen zijn we op zoek naar een Cloud Data Engineer. Volgende week dinsdag bespreken we de details van deze rol met Telenet, maar hier alvast wat meer info:

At Telenet, data & analytics are recognized as the “fuel and engine under the hood” that can improve every aspect of our business and make us more and more “customer intimate”.
As a data driven company, we have one data organization with one plan and one voice to deal with data holistically and strategically. Our data & analytics experts are constantly striving for value creation for and with our business and our customers. They do this by building high-quality data assets, innovative AI products, strong insight cases and in-market experiments into the fabric of the business teams.
In order to enable all this valuable work, there is a Data Platform & Architecture team within the tribe as well consisting out of data architects and cloud data engineers with a mission to build and maintain state of the art data services towards the company. Now for the best part, we want you to become part of it as senior cloud data engineer!

Make a difference and…

  *   Work on projects related to Big Data, Data Warehousing, ML Ops, AI engineering et cetera.
  *   Build products/services in AWS from secure storage to processing power, purpose-based access management and general accelerators that can bring efficiency and effectiveness towards the tribe.
  *   Abstract underlying infrastructure to enable your customer to focus on the data processing and allowing the platform team to rapidly follow new technologies without having to trigger a migration project.
  *   Take a leading role in technology innovations and support the landing of them, together with the architects, in the various value teams.

Got this?

  *   A Master or bachelor’s in computer science or related education / experience.
  *   Profound experience in a production-level data environments.
  *   Excellent knowledge on AWS, Terraform and Python.
  *   Good knowledge of EMR, EKS, Spark, Gitlab and Snowflake.
  *   Experience with modern schedulers: Airflow, Prefect, …
  *   Experience with scalable API development in a challenging production environment.
  *   Experience in a DevOps world is a plus, the will to take end-to-end ownership is a must.
  *   Good communication skills. You feel comfortable challenging others.
  *   Profound English skills. Dutch skills are a plus.
  *   The ability to get things done.
  *   Data privacy and ethics on your mind

Als je een geschikte kandidaat hebt of dinsdag meer informatie wenst twijfel dan niet om me te contacteren.

Met vriendelijke groeten,

[cid:image001.png@01DA1948.E7A30050]
Wout
Account Manager

body:
Collega’s,

Ter vervanging van één van onze consultants, zoeken wij naar een ervaren cloud data engineer.

Start: november 2023

At Telenet, data & analytics are recognized as the “fuel and engine under the hood” that can improve every aspect of our business and make us more and more “customer intimate”.

As a data driven company, we have one data organization with one plan and one voice to deal with data holistically and strategically. Our data & analytics experts are constantly striving for value creation for and with our business and our customers. They do this by building innovative data pipelines, delivering insights use cases, integrate analytics and in-market experiments into the fabric of the business teams.


  *   Become part of a squad that manages the Data Platform as a product.
contribute to the data product roadmap, which we prioritize as a team on a quarterly basis to fuel the overall company roadmap and initiatives with analytics
fit our data products with the overall data architecture, governance, standards, and guidelines

  *   design, build and test our data products
  *   meet the functional & non-functional requirements,
  *   meet the high standards for data ingestion, processing & storage
…and applying the right level of trust (quality, privacy, security) for their purpose
communicate on a regular basis to our stakeholders to increase data product awareness & usage

  *   Take a pivotal role in the development of new data platform capabilities. Optimize the delivery and operations of data solutions. Identify and roll-out solutions that enable our data scientists, engineers, and analysts to sustainably derive more value out of our data faster – in the form of new platform components, frameworks, and onboarding of cloud services for large-scale, robust, and real-time data ingestion, processing, modeling & analytics.
  *   Explore how cloud-based systems and pipelines can be used optimally to enhance the existing Big Data Platform.
  *   Democratize access to (large-scale) information assets for business users.
  *   Work in a young and dynamic team of data architects and engineers, operating in a self-organizing agile at company scale context.

You have proven experience in:

  *   existing and upcoming Data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SQL, Flink, Cassandra, ELK, ...) and like to stay in touch with new evolutions.
  *   Designing and building cloud-based data solutions and more specifically with AWS (IAM, S3, Glue, EMR, EKS, Sagemaker, …)
     *   Knowledge or experience of the following technologies is a plus. If you don’t master these yet, don’t worry! We can provide tailored inhouse training and coaching when required:
     *   System administration with Unix/Linux and knowledge of Docker or Kubernetes and containerization
  *   Knowledge of proven software development best practices (coding standards, CI/CD, infrastructure as code)
  *   You are eager to learn and like variation in your job working on different scopes
  *   You have a knack for spotting optimization potential and know how to realize it with robust engineering
  *   You possess good communication skills. You feel comfortable challenging others
  *   The ability to get things done and take end-to-end ownership
  *   You are pragmatic in your approach. You use the right techniques to provide the needed quality and detail while avoiding complex solutions.
  *   Good English skills. Dutch is a plus.

Mvg



Account Manager

CRONOS NV
Veldkant 33A
2550 KONTICH

M

body:
Hallo,

Voor Volvo Group (Gent) zoeken we een MS Azure data architect.
Graag cv, ic en beschikbaarheden van eigen medewerkes of direcete freelancers.
Regime : FTE met 50% on site.
Bedankt.

We are looking for an Data architect Azure, with a good overall understanding of available services in the Azure Analytics stack.
This person is required to take the lead as Data Architect for GTO Manufacturing & Powertrain projects.
We need this person to keep everything together but also to have practical experience to dive in and setup different environments & services.
Leadership capabilities needed as this person is supposed to take the technical lead role and discussion with Business Stakeholders.

Working alongside with multiple product teams, you provide architecture leadership and support within the end-to-end lifecycle of managing data.
• You provide technical leadership, you participate in development efforts, and you represent the full internal and external capabilities of the platform.
• You will be an active member of the architects guild to oversee data management process and provide guidance and direction to development teams - including design, documentation, maintenance, enhancements and validation.
• You have a proven experience in one of following development track: Analytics & BI development, data analysis, data engineering, platforms administration.
• As architect, you have experiences on Azure Cloud platform around data (Databricks, ADLS storage, SQL DB...), and you know technologies like Python or Spark. Experience with Angular, ADF, Power BI is an advantage.
• You have experiences in defining and owning end-to-end scalable Data Architecture taking into account enterprise architecture and industry standards.
• You have participated in the development of architectures, strategies, and policies around data, including data governance, master data management, metadata management, data quality and data security.
• You are used to develop, document and maintain logical and physical data models.
• You are used to work closely with multiple internal teams including compliance, privacy, risk, information security, support and operations to ensure all business requirements are considered in the design process

Competences & Skills Mandatory:
• Data Architecture has been your world for minimum 4 years 
• Writing SQL and doing data modelling are natural to you
• Data Architecture design
• Azure components like ADFv2, Databricks, Synapse, Delta lake
• Azure Advanced Analytics technologies and frameworks
• Advanced Analytics related programming language: Python, Pyspark
• Microsoft cloud based delivery model
• Data Management, Data Governance and Data Quality
• API or microservice deployment
• Data Integration and Processing real time/streaming data
• DevSecOps
•appreciation of the purpose and the practices of Agile
• You have experience working in a global environment
• You have demonstrated a growth and learning mindset.
• You have excellent communication skills in French and English (C1 level)

Philip
Business Development Manager
92
Phone : 
Address : Veldkant 33a – 2550 Kontich – Belgium

body:
ENKEL RECHTSTREEKS, GEEN TUSSENPARTIJEN AUB

VOORKEUR VOOR VASTE MEDEWERKERS





Hallo collega’s,



Voor Swift zoeken we een Data Engineer - Customer Experience die voldoet aan volgende beschrijving:



Gewenste startdatum: 15/02/2023

Einddatum: 01/05/2023 - Mogelijkheid tot verlenging met 6 maanden







Job Summary


The department Customer Experience’s purpose is to take away friction for our Customers and employees and create a better experience.

The Voice of the Customer, Customer insights team, is hiring a Data Engineer to set up and improve data streams to a central data hub, from which service delivery performance data can be analysed.


The job requires working in close collaboration with the various services delivery teams as well as key Customer Experience Transformation programme teams such as the customer journey teams.


Key tasks include

  *   design, build and integrate data pipes from multiple sources where services data is available, but not yet exploitable
  *   In collaboration with the team, you will need to define data ingestion rules and data management tools, so that large amounts of data can be analysed by business analysts and data scientists or put available to business teams through self-service mechanisms.

This is a unique opportunity for a team player who likes new challenges and wants to develop her/his data engineering and mining skills, as well as networking skills to deliver top quality work with impact on the future of a world-class customer services. In this role you will be exposed to SWIFT’s strategic programs, and be working closely with both CeX and services teams to deliver insights and value to their objectives.


Job Description


What to expect:


• Define data analysis use cases with stakeholders in services or CeX teams (users or business analysts)

• Set up data pipes to get data from various systems in the right date and formats where needed.

• Set up data use cases using existing data feeds and points in platforms such as OASIS, iRiS, Watch;

• Cleaning process of data


  *   Build an automatic monitoring of the cleaning flow
  *   Define “self-services” dashboards and analysis for direct usage by stakeholders


Once the cleaning process has been concluded per request and/or project, perform Data analysis to turn data into insights in collaboration with the business teams.

Understanding and maintaining our current analytic platform and enhancing dashboards, adding new / revised dashboards, perhaps?

Our current platform is providing advanced analytics insights based on the replication of database information, the data engineer will ensure the end-to-end replication flow is running and monitored.

  *    Follow-up on the mandatory COTS upgrades
  *   Upgrade of R and Python libraries complying with the company security policies
  *   The scope of our analytics activities will be extended to other services areas and platforms, and will require some new infrastructure/tooling to be set up
  *   Explore and identify the most suitable solution in Operational or financial data warehouses and/or data lakes

This solution will integrate data coming from various data sources, and the data engineer role would be to contribute to the definition and set-up of the best storage structure, for both our Data warehouse and data lake, as well as a future data management platform flow the data into our warehouse (stream and flow). Setup a report server whereby self-service dashboard can be accessed by the business/delivery users, without having to install local client software or distribute static excel based reports (e.g. Shiny server)


What will make you successful:


• University degree or equivalent

• Min. 3 years experience as Data Engineer

• Passionate about data analysis, data engineering and science.

• Excellent analytics skills on large data sets and have the ability to synthesis into key findings

• Knowledge of databases

• Knowledge of SQL, Hadoop, Kafka

• Knowledge of programming languages R, R Studio, Python (what about Python libraries, like Pandas, NumPy etc)?

• Knowledge of data visualization tools - Tableau / Microstrategies/Shiny/Kibana)

• Build collaborative networks with key stakeholders.

• Excellent interpersonal skills to deal with a wide range of internal customers and stakeholders.

• Experience with SWIFT products and services either from a technical services, support or business perspective is a strong asset

• A team player, willing to work in a multicultural environment

• Fluent in English



Indien jullie geschikte kandidaten hebben ontvang ik graag hun beschikbaarheid, CV en kostprijs.

Alvast hartelijk bedankt.



Met vriendelijke groeten,



[cid:6f079eb5-4b2d-480d-b194-389d96544609]

Hélène 

Key Account Manager

Business Park King Square

body:
Collega’s,

Voor KBC zoeken we een Data Engineer:

The 'red thread' within our SAFE Data trains is the development of and support for DI solutions. We set up Big Data solutions with their specific tools & technologies (Python, Spark, AWS, ...). With the evolution towards a data driven organization, the intensive use of commercial data and data analysis has become a strategic core competence of KBC. Together with our business partners we are building and managing multiple new high-quality data layers (Commercial data, Risk data, etc.) that contain correct and consistent data, based on unambiguous definitions, compliant with the new GDPR legislation and that can be accessed at the right time in the right form and through the right channel. For the governance of that data, we are implementing Collibra as standard governance tool for KBC Group. Collibra will also become the master for all the metadata needed to drive all our Big Data- related pipelines.

For this implementation we are looking for additional a motivated Senior Data Engineer - Big Data with expert knowledge of the tools and technologies used in Big Data such as Python scripting Apache Spark , AWS (Lambda, S3, IAM, Athena,...) I,ETL concepts, REST API, setting up pipelines, Apache Airflow, CICD, ... . Some knowledge of Collibra is definitely a plus

As a Senior Data Engineer
- Big Data, you and your colleagues will be responsible for the technical and architectural design and implementation (both creation and maintenance) of the Meta Data Repository. This MDR will be fed by meta data
input from Collibra and other KBC systems and the MDR will reproduce the collected meta data in a structured format that can be used by ingestion process, GDPR process, ...
• Making together with our system architect a technical design of the MDR •Developing with focus on test driven approach the MDR
• Technical implementation of new data feeds from and towards the MDR, performing ETL tasks and following up on job-scheduling, release planning and knowledge transfer and retention.
• Compiling all necessary system and user documentation • Further extend, support and manage the MDR.

Expert knowledge of the tools and technologies used in Big Data such as Python scripting Apache Spark , AWS (Lambda, S3, IAM, Athena,...),ETL concepts, REST API, setting up pipelines, Apache Airflow, CICD, ... . Some knowledge of Collibra is definitely a plus

Dutch is required!!

Locatie: Leuven
Periode: ASAP – 31/03/2023

Met vriendelijke groet,

[cid:image002.png@01D90568.2490D730]
Thomas 
Account Manager

Business Park King Square

body:
Collega’s,

Voor KBC zoeken we een Cloud platform engineer in a data analytics context

What does this function mean?
KBC group is currently creating a new big data platform in AWS. On top of the platform, we are building a platform that focuses on supporting data science and other technical computing workflows.
You will participate in this effort, as a valuable team player, to analyse, design, and implement the platform in close collaboration with data scientists.
What do we expect from you?
As a platform engineer for data science, you are responsible for engineering a well architected data science platform with particular emphasis in interactive computing and highly automated model lifecycle management
based on MLOps. Main considerations for the design include security, maintainability, flexibility, user-friendliness and integration between components on the platform.
You work closely with data scientists to understand their functional needs and translate them in an actual solution. Then, you rapidly iterate over the solution based on frequent feedback from data scientists.
Due to how the platform is used in the group, you are also responsible for documenting guidelines for future platform operators.

Your strength?
An ideal candidate should have:
- Good working knowledge of cloud computing in general, and AWS specifically (AWS IAM, EC2, S3,VPC) As KBC has chosen for AWS as a cloud service provider we often mention their technology in this job description. Decent Cloud experience (doesn ‘t matter which Cloud, as long as it is one of the big three (GCP, Azure or AWS)) and Infrastructure-as-Code experience is also valuable.
- Other AWS services such as Cognito, Lambda, CloudWatch, ECR, Athena etc
- Basic understanding of AWS products related to machine learning (AWS SageMaker, MLFlow)
- Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (IAC) tools such as Terraform, Pulumi, AWS CloudFormation etc
- Kubernetes / Helm
- Good knowledge of user management (authentication and authorization) with AWS products and OSS solutions
- Good grasp of big data ecosystem and tooling especially Apache Spark and related technologies
- Good verbal and written communication skill in English
- Willingness to work in close collaboration with data scientists and other engineers from different teams
- An ability to work in a highly dynamic environment
- A can-do attitude to cope with non-technical constraints

Locatie: Leuven
Periode: ASAP – 31/12/2023



Met vriendelijke groet,


[cid:image001.png@01D8FA7D.D872FC60]

Account Manager

##################@email.com<mailto:##################@email.com>

Business Park King Square
Veldkant 33A | B-2550 Kontich

body:
Beste P&C,

ENKEL VASTE WERKNEMERS

Voor een klant in Brussel zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Engineer (Medior profiel).

Role description:

As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role preparing the infrastructure and data that will be used to deliver high quality data products. You will help us design, develop and maintain data pipelines that will deliver insights.
By using a DevOps approach, you will make sure the overall system is running on all times by automating tasks so you can spend time on creating and not deploying. You will also make sure the system is appropriately tested and monitored by using adapted methods and tools.
You will collaborate with the other data engineers and data scientists of the Advanced Analytics team to create the simplest possible effective data landscape to improve delivery speed of future AI use cases.

Required Responsibilities:

- Execute ETL (extract\/transform\/load) processes from complex and\/or large data sets
- Collaborate with machine learning engineers for the implementation, deployment, scheduling and monitoring of different solutions
- Ensure robust CI\/CD processes are in place
- Promote DevOps best practices in the team
- Simplify & optimize existing pipelines if needed
- Ensure data are easily accessible and that their exploitation is performing as requested, even in highly scalable circumstances
- Conceive and build data architectures to support data scientists
- Participate to the architecture and planning of the big data platform to optimize the ecosystem’s performances
- Participate in the short\/mid\/long term vision of the overall system
- Create large data warehouses fit for further reporting or advanced analytics

Degree & Experience:

- University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics... or equivalent work experience with specialized training\/certification
- 3+ years of experience supporting or working in Data engineering environments
- Knowledge of the telco or ICT industry
- Experience with an agile way of working is a plus

Technical skills:

- Data pipeline management (sqoop, hive, nifi)
- Cluster management (Cloudera)
- Workflow management (Oozie, Airflow)
- Database management of SQL and NoSQL databases
- Large file storage (HDFS, Data Lake, S3, Blob storage,..)
- Data science environment setup (conda, jupyter)
- Strong knowledge of Scala and Python
- Strong knowledge & experience in Spark (Scala and Pyspark)
- Strong knowledge of CI\/CD concepts
- Strong knowledge of SQL (Teradata \/Oracle)
- High level understanding of data science concepts
- Knowledge of Linux \/ Windows server (connection, folder creation, software installation, , creation of ODBC connections, work in client-server environment, IT infrastructure (support groups, admin rights, )
- Stream processing such as Kafka, Kinesis, Elasticsearch is a plus
- Experience with AWS is a plus

Attitudes\/Behavior:

- You’re quality oriented
- You are an excellent problem analyser and solver
- You’re open minded, collaborative, team player, ready to adapt to the changing needs
- You are curious about new techniques and tools, eagerness to always keep learning
- You are convinced having a good infrastructure is essential & you can motivate and drive changes if needed
- You’re committed to deliver, pragmatic and solution oriented.

Languages:

Very good knowledge of English and French or Dutch

Bij interesse, gelieve CV door te sturen.


Met vriendelijke groeten,

Kind regards,



[image]

Chrissie Vandesande

TALENT ACQUISITION LEAD

body:
Beste P&C,



Voor een klant te Brussel zijn wij op zoek naar een Cloud Architect with a broad knowledge of Azure.



Startdatum: 01\/04\/2024

Doorlooptijd: 01\/04\/2024 tot 30\/09\/2024 met optie tot verlenging

Bezetting: Full-time (40u)

Talen: Engels (spreken en schrijven) + NL & FR is een plus

Locatie: onsite - Proximus headquarters Brussels

The candidate should be very knowledgeable on Azure cloud platform and its native components.
Apart from that, we are really looking also for a person that knows how to design a framework around containerisation of spark data processing with AKS.

Role Description
We are looking for an experienced cloud architect with a very strong knowledge of the Azure ecosystem with an in-depth knowledge of the technical components such platform has to offer.
As a cloud architect, you will be helping our internal architects setting up the architectural landscape & frameworks that will allow us to go forward in our cloudification process.

Designing, implementing, and managing cloud solutions using Microsoft Azure. You will work closely with our architects & engineers to understand their needs and provide them with optimal cloud solutions. You will also provide solutions for the migration of existing applications and data to the cloud. You will help defining & setting up security, scalability, reliability of our cloud infrastructure and services and make sure they achieve the required performance.

Responsibilities
Some of the main responsibilities for this role are:
• Design and develop cloud architectures and solutions using the Azure platform and best practices
• Define cloud enablers according to the target architecture and propose solutions
• Provide technical guidance and support to other architects, developers, and engineers
• Evaluate and compare different Azure options and components to come up with the best fit for our requirements and budget
• Define and implement frameworks and standards for our data pipelines within Azure
• First assignment will be to successfully plan & implement a set of proof of concepts relying on the Azure ecosystem

Qualifications
To be successful in this role, you should have:
• A master’s degree in computer science, engineering, information technology, or related field
• A minimum of 10 years experience in data as a data engineer or architect
• At least 5 years of experience in cloud computing, preferably with Azure
      o relevant Azure certification, such as AZ-303, AZ-304, or AZ-500 is a plus
• Proficient in Azure services and tools, such as ADLS, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps, Azure Monitor, SQL DB, Databricks, Azure Data Catalog, APIM, Azure Security Center, etc.
• Strong knowledge about Spark , Kafka , Kubernetes (AKS)
• Strong knowledge of cloud architecture principles and patterns, such as microservices, serverless, event-driven, containerisation principles etc.
• Experience in migrating and developing cloud-based applications and data pipelines
• Familiarity with programming languages, such as Python, Java, PowerShell, etc.
• Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills
• You can connect to technical people and executive people.



Bij interesse mag u steeds de CV + tarief doorsturen.



Met vriendelijke groeten,

Kind regards,



[image]

Chrissie Vandesande

TALENT ACQUISITION LEAD

+32 476 70 25 45

##################@email.com<mailto:##################@email.com>

Beste,

Voor Belfius zoeken wij een Azure Synapse (Spark) Data Engineer

We are seeking a highly skilled Azure Synapse (Spark) Data Engineer with proven experience in designing, developing and implementing large-scale solutions on Azure Synapse Analytics.
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, data modelling and data integration.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop and implement data solutions on the Azure Synapse Analytics platform using Spark SQL.
Develop data pipelines and workflows for data ingestion, processing and storage
Design and implement data models and schemas to support business requirements
Optimize data storage and processing for performance and scalability
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement end-to-end data solutions and ensure the successful delivery of projects
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues
Create and maintain technical documentation
Review code of developers from the team which are new to Synapse Analytics
Develop and review templates to establish reusable pieces of code for the company
Review technical designs
Participate to the coaching of developers who need to transition from PL SQL to Spark SQL

Requirements:

Masters degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
3+ years of experience with Azure Synapse Analytics
5 to 10 years of experience working with a solution implying the use of notebooks such as Azure Databricks
5+ years of experience in data engineering
Strong understanding of data modeling and database design principles
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks
Experience with data integration and ETL Tools
Experience with Spark SQL, pySpark is a plus
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills

Nederlands\/Frans & Engels
Medior 3 - 8 years experience

body:
Dag Ben,

Excuses voor de vertraging. Maar bij deze de functiebeschrijving voor de open positie in mijn chapter.

Met vriendelijke groeten,

Sofie Theunissen



SWIFT is a member-owned cooperative that provides the communications platform, products and services to connect more than 10,000 banking organizations, securities institutions and corporate customers in 211 countries. As part of its Instant, Frictionless payments strategy, SWIFT is rapidly expanding its Data & Analytics capabilities to support our customers in this area of understanding payments.
In this context, the Data and Analytics tribe is looking for a Senior Data Engineer with excellent technical skills combined with a real sense of leadership and responsibility. Together with the team, you will have the opportunity to build the foundations of the new Data Management Platform (DMP).
The foundation squad, based in Kuala Lumpur (KL) and in HQ (BE), contributes to the DMP platform evolution. You will design, develop, test and deploy new features and components requested by the delivery teams.  The foundation squad also has the responsibility to share best practices and expertise with the business squads.
Responsibilities:

  *   Design, develop, test and deploy projects for the Data Management Platform.
  *   Analyse detail systems factors: input\/output requirements, information flow, hardware and software requirements, alternative approaches, etc.
  *   Validate alternative problem management proposals and make decisions on solutions.
  *   Provide technical assistance to other colleagues and assist in resolving problems reported by less senior team members.
  *   Provide technical guidance to customers and act as a mentor to less senior team members. May give presentations to management and stakeholders.
  *   Prepare and complete system documentation and operating procedures.
  *   Lead design review meetings for small to medium size\/complexity\/risk projects.
  *   Coordinate and monitor the activities, such as schedules and costs, of a small project team.
  *   Evaluate and recommend technical feasibility and estimates of the proposed systems solutions.
Qualifications:

  *   Minimum 8 years of IT development\/testing\/integration experience
Technical Skills Requirements:

•          Proven experience in Data engineering and Software development practices.

•          Advanced hands-on expertise in Java 11 and 17 is a must

•          Understanding of containerization technologies like Openshift and Kubernetes

•          Experience with massive object storage services (Amazon S3 storage or equivalent) is a plus

•          Solid understanding of Data Engineering, data hub, data lake and data warehousing concepts

•          Experience in Data API and solid understanding of distributed systems

•          Strong knowledge of web-service related technologies: XML, JSON, RESTFul web-services

•          Experience with scripting language, primarily in Unix Shell, Perl, Python

•          Experience in continuous integration\/delivery build environment: GIT, Jenkins, Maven, Coverage and Static\/Dynamic Code Analysis tools.

•          Knowledge on microservices architecture

•          Experience with PKI and SSL

•          Experience in an Agile\/Scrum software development environment

•          Experience with Agile Tools (JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Github)
Professional Skills Requirements:

  *   Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
  *   Able to lead, coach and groom junior members
  *   Passionate about change and improvements
  *   Team player, willing to work in a multicultural environment
  *   Demonstrate aptitude for learning new technologies quickly
  *   Practical working experience in Agile development ( scrum ) context
  *   Knows or wants to learn how to translate business problems into software and technical requirements
  *   Strong interpersonal skills, customer centric attitude, ability to deal with cultural diversity
  *   Able to thrive in a fast paced, goals and deadlines driven environment

Ben,

We zoeken nog een consultant voor Ravago in Arendonk.
Hebben jullie mogelijkheden bij Infofarm ?

Mvg,

Gerrit.


  *   Data Engineer - Analyst

Purpose of the role


  *   “Data is the new gold”.  Within Ravago data is considered as a key asset to drive their business and make the best possible decisions . To strengthen the data team, we are looking for a data engineer with strong analytical skills. As a data engineer you will transform data into a useful format for analysis and will tackle complex technological projects.

Requirements


Education

  *   Master Degree within IT\/Business and Information Systems Engineering
  *   Or clearly demonstrable skills as a Data Engineer – Analyst within the domain of data intelligence

Experience

  *   Proven experience (+3 years)
  *   Hands-on Experience in complex analysis and building data pipelines to integrate multiple data sources into data solutions
  *   Experience in DWH and architecture assets, on premise as within the cloud
  *   The ability to model data solutions (Kimball, DataVault,…)
  *   Solid programming skills with ETL and reporting tools as well as Python\/SQL querying;
  *   Familiar with CI-CD tool is a plus


Competences

  *   You recognize yourself in the core values of Ravago : Entrepreneurship, Human focus, Professionalism and Humility
  *   Ability to see the overall picture
  *   Excellent analytical skills, conceptual and problem-solving abilities
  *   A strong team player with the necessary communication skills and can-do mentality
  *   Ability to work well independently and within deadlines
  *   Proven data modelling skills in a DWH context
  *   Strong technical skills :
     *   ETL tools : DBT or similar (Informatica,…)
     *   Reporting Tools : Tableau, Power BI, Business Objects

     *   Databases : Snowflake, DB2 and others (Oracle, SQL Server, …)
     *   Azure Cloud : CI\/CD, Datalake, Eventhub, ….
     *   SQL
     *   Python


Language skills

  *   Fluent knowledge of Dutch and English is required, both verbal and written.



Other skills

  *   Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 applications.
  *   Experienced in Scrum and related toolings (Jira, Confluence,…)


Principal Responsibilities



  *   You like to go end-2-end from requirements gathering, over analysis till the implementation
  *   You describe and document the needed solution (estimations, modelling,…)
  *   Develop and deliver the projects within time, scope and budget
  *   Validate together with your process owners the solutions you have build

body:
Collega’s,

Voor KBC zijn we op zoek naar een Product Owner Data Engineering:

Description
We are looking for a motivated Product Owner Data Engineering, who wants to help us in envisioning, defining and managing the frameworks and tools used by the teams delivering data driven solutions on Edison. As most of the data engineering managed products are deep technical, a practical background and experience in the delivery of software is advised.

• You want to be part and contribute to the core strategy of KBC for the data Strategy and one of the major international initiatives in KBC
• Does team coaching and coaching individuals give you energy?
• You like working with IT Delivery in an international co-operation?
• Big Data and AI fascinates you?
• Are constructive criticism and creativity in your nature?
• Are you excited by working in an international context?
• Are you looking to develop your potential and work in a continuously changing environment?
• Are you a flexible problem solver who takes responsibility?

Answered YES to these questions? Then keep on reading, because you could be just the candidate we are looking for.
Teams work together as part of an Agile Release Train in a 3-monthly cadence to deliver the required software, development- and test processes, frameworks and standards, integration patterns and security aspects.

In close cooperation with the Product Manager and System Architects, you
• contribute to the overall Edison Solution with a strong focus on frameworks and tools geared towards the Data Engineering community;
• manage improvements handling and communication with the customer base;

Together with the Product Experts, you
• define and align the long-term Product Roadmap to match the overall goals of the Edison Roadmap;
• continuously drive short -term improvements of existing products;  

In close cooperation with the Scrum Master, you
• guide the team in delivering high quality products

Where is this function positioned?
The Data Engineering team provides frameworks and tools to the teams delivering data driven solutions on Edison. Those frameworks abstract away the complexity and set standards for GDPR, lineage, protection, scheduling, build and deploy, data processing and metadata. More details on our products can be found in our product catalog.

What will you do in this job?
The Product Owner is steering the Agile team on the content level. Based upon interaction with the users of the products, PO-peers, product manager, enterpise-\/system-architects and the product experts in the team you build a vision for the products. You translate this vision into a roadmap and define the roadmap into concrete prioritized features and stories to deliver in the next PI's. During the implementation of these stories you guard the quality of the delivery and work in tandem with the Scrum Master. He is responsible for the organizational aspects of steering the team.

Your key strengths?
You are a friendly communicator with excellent communication skills who shows courage to challenge existing imperfections and to experiment.
• Based on trust you motivate and inspire the team to go the extra mile.
• You set goals in the near and distance future and guide people on the path towards a vision.
• You make balanced decisions on scope and priority.
• You summarize (vocal and on paper) conclusions, understandable throughout the chain of hierarchy.
• You apply your personal coaching skills to make people grow.
• You are open for new ideas and insights, who facilitates consensus, showing patience.
• You show low tolerance for organizational impediments.

Locatie: Leuven (50% onsite)
Periode: ASAP – 31\/12\/2024

Met vriendelijke groet,
[cid:image002.png@01DA5A9A.5091D950]
Thomas Van Huffel
Account Manager
+32 485 76 52 20
##################@email.com<mailto:##################@email.com>

Business Park King Square
Veldkant 33A | B-2550 Kontich

body:
Beste,

Voor onze klant zoeken wij een AI engineer :

Are you passionate about #AI or #cybersecurity? You love working with high profile teams with a sure taste for challenge and variety? You dream to join a fast-growing company with start-up mentality? Eager to learn continuously? Join our centre of excellence for AI and Cybersecurity, the team of data scientists, data engineers and analytics translators, supports in designing, developing and deploying internal AI-driven applications in line with the business needs.

Role description
As an AI engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right AI solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities
-             Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology
-             Translate business requests into AI applications.
-             Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
-             Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value.
-             Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems.
-             Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams.
-             Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Degree & Experience
-             PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
-             2+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical skills
-             Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem.
-             Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...)
-             Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods.
-             Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
•             Translating business requests into data requirements.
•             Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
•             Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
•             Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
-             Any experience with following elements is a big plus:
•             MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI\/CD, etc.
•             Containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes
-             Any experience with cloud technology (AWS, Azure) is a big plus

Attitudes\/Behavior
-             Passionate about AI and a constant learner
-             Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value
-             Team player with strong communication and presentation skills
-             Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers
-             Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus

Languages
Fluent in English and preferably also Dutch and\/or French.
Job Posting Start Date:   01\/02\/2024
Job Posting End Date:   31\/12\/2024

Mvg,

Mireille De Keuleneir
Key Account Manager

Beste collega’s,

Voor Galapagos ben ik op zoek naar volgend profiel. Enkel werknemers en directe freelancers graag.

Core Purpose of Job:
We are looking for a senior Cloud Data Engineer with strong developer background to strengthen our team's capabilities. The selected candidate will play a vital role in contributing to Galapagos' data and application projects.
Principal Accountabilities:
The candidates should demonstrate substantial hands-on experience in the following areas:
• Designing and implementing pipeline orchestration in Airflow
• Developing ETL code in Cloud DBT
• Modelling and implementing data marts in Snowflake
• Serving as a technical team leader for colleagues
• Developing backend applications on AWS
o Serverless computing with AWS Lambda
o Utilizing AWS SAM, AWS CLI, and AWS Console for service management
o Managing infrastructure using AWS CloudFormation
o Demonstrating expertise in AWS DynamoDB for database handling
o Ensuring the creation, publication, and security of APIs via AWS API Gateway
• Programming and adhering to best practices: Writing clean, efficient, and welldocumented code in Python
• Proficiency with version control systems like Git, and experience using platforms like
Bitbucket or GitHub.
• Containerization and Orchestration: Understanding Docker for containerization and
orchestration tools like Kubernetes for managing containerized applications.
• Engaging in continuous learning to stay updated with the latest trends and
technologies
• Collaborating closely with other developers, IT professionals, and stakeholders to
understand integration requirements and deliver effective solutions
• Documenting all processes and changes for future reference and compliance
purposes
Working Relationships:
• ITS Domain Owner\/s
• ITS Architect\/s
• ITS Scrum Master\/s
• ITS IT Analysts, Data engineer, Developers, and Data Analyses (and by extension other expert members who are part of the scrum team)
Job requirements:
Education (add qualification if relevant) & experience:
• A quick learner with an enthusiastic personality who enjoys challenges.
• Strong communication skills with business professionals.
• Values such as integrity, teamwork, commitment, and results orientation are important to
you.
• 3+ years of experience in AWS cloud engineering (certification is an advantage)
• Over 10 years of experience in software development (Java, Scala, Python, ...)
• 3+ years of experience in data engineering on serverless DWH (Snowflake, BigQuery,…)
• 2+ years of experience with Confluence\/Jira\/Bitbucket\/Docker\/CICD tools
• Experience with DBT and Cloud DBT
• Experience with data modeling is an advantage
• Experience with MLOps is an advantage
Language Skills:
English: Fluent
Dutch: Preferred
Location:
Mechelen
Remote work possible on selected days (to be aligned with scrum master)

Met vriendelijke groeten – Cordialement – Kind Regards,
